oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin York on the steps of Jackson's tomb

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Heroes; Military uniforms; Medals; Tombs & sepulchral monuments
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World War, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History; Hermitage (Hermitage, Tenn.); Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin York in his uniform standing on the steps of the tomb monument of Andrew Jackson at the Hermitage. He wears his military uniform and has his visor cap in his hand.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Marvin W.Wiles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin York was one of the most decorated American soldiers in World War I. He was awarded a Medal of Honor and a French Croix de Guerre for taking a German machine gun nest and assisting in the capture of 132 German soldiers.
